description: Imports a disk into an EBS snapshot. For more information, see Importing a disk as a snapshot using VM Import/Export in the VM Import/Export User Guide.

parameters.name: ClientData
parameters.description: The client-specific data. Comment (string) --- A user-defined comment about the disk upload. UploadEnd (datetime) --- The time that the disk upload ends. UploadSize (float) --- The size of the uploaded disk image, in GiB. UploadStart (datetime) --- The time that the disk upload starts.

nested_params.name: Comment
nested_params.description: A user-defined comment about the disk upload.

nested_params.name: UploadEnd
nested_params.description: The time that the disk upload ends.

nested_params.name: UploadSize
nested_params.description: The size of the uploaded disk image, in GiB.

nested_params.name: UploadStart
nested_params.description: The time that the disk upload starts.

parameters.name: DiskContainer
parameters.description: Information about the disk container. Description (string) --- The description of the disk image being imported. Format (string) --- The format of the disk image being imported. Valid values: VHD | VMDK | RAW Url (string) --- The URL to the Amazon S3-based disk image being imported. It can either be a https URL (https://..) or an Amazon S3 URL (s3://..). UserBucket (dict) --- The Amazon S3 bucket for the disk image. S3Bucket (string) --- The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where the disk image is located. S3Key (string) --- The file name of the disk image.

nested_params.name: Description
nested_params.description: The description of the disk image being imported.

nested_params.name: Format
nested_params.description: The format of the disk image being imported. Valid values: VHD | VMDK | RAW.

nested_params.name: Url
nested_params.description: The URL to the Amazon S3-based disk image being imported. It can either be a https URL (https://..) or an Amazon S3 URL (s3://..).

nested_params.name: UserBucket
nested_params.description: The Amazon S3 bucket for the disk image.

nested_params.name: S3Bucket
nested_params.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where the disk image is located.

nested_params.name: S3Key
nested_params.description: The file name of the disk image.

parameters.name: KmsKeyId
parameters.description: An identifier for the symmetric KMS key to use when creating the encrypted snapshot. This parameter is only required if you want to use a non-default KMS key; if this parameter is not specified, the default KMS key for EBS is used. If a KmsKeyId is specified, the Encrypted flag must also be set. The KMS key identifier may be provided in any of the following formats: Key ID Key alias ARN using key ID. The ID ARN contains the arn:aws:kms namespace, followed by the Region of the key, the Amazon Web Services account ID of the key owner, the key namespace, and then the key ID. For example, arn:aws:kms:us-east-1:012345678910:key/abcd1234-a123-456a-a12b-a123b4cd56ef. ARN using key alias. The alias ARN contains the arn:aws:kms namespace, followed by the Region of the key, the Amazon Web Services account ID of the key owner, the alias namespace, and then the key alias. For example, arn:aws:kms:us-east-1:012345678910:alias/ExampleAlias. Amazon Web Services parses KmsKeyId asynchronously, meaning that the action you call may appear to complete even though you provided an invalid identifier. This action will eventually report failure. The specified KMS key must exist in the Region that the snapshot is being copied to. Amazon EBS does not support asymmetric KMS keys.

parameters.name: TagSpecifications
parameters.description: The tags to apply to the import snapshot task during creation. (dict) --- The tags to apply to a resource when the resource is being created. When you specify a tag, you must specify the resource type to tag, otherwise the request will fail. ResourceType (string) --- The type of resource to tag on creation. Tags (list) --- The tags to apply to the resource. (dict) --- Describes a tag. Key (string) --- The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:. Value (string) --- The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

nested_params.name: ResourceType
nested_params.description: The type of resource to tag on creation.

nested_params.name: Tags
nested_params.description: The tags to apply to the resource.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of the import snapshot task.

nested_items.name: ImportTaskId
nested_items.description: The ID of the import snapshot task.

nested_items.name: SnapshotTaskDetail
nested_items.description: Information about the import snapshot task.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description of the disk image being imported.

nested_items.name: DiskImageSize
nested_items.description: The size of the disk in the snapshot, in GiB.

nested_items.name: Encrypted
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the snapshot is encrypted.

nested_items.name: Format
nested_items.description: The format of the disk image from which the snapshot is created.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The identifier for the KMS key that was used to create the encrypted snapshot.

nested_items.name: Progress
nested_items.description: The percentage of completion for the import snapshot task.

nested_items.name: SnapshotId
nested_items.description: The snapshot ID of the disk being imported.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: A brief status for the import snapshot task.

nested_items.name: StatusMessage
nested_items.description: A detailed status message for the import snapshot task.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The URL of the disk image from which the snapshot is created.

nested_items.name: UserBucket
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 bucket for the disk image.

nested_items.name: S3Bucket
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 bucket from which the disk image was created.

nested_items.name: S3Key
nested_items.description: The file name of the disk image.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: Any tags assigned to the import snapshot task.
